result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kahlil Darquise Snow

records.addlTxt:
9:00 AM Attorney Drew Lehman in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kahlil Darquise Snow in court.  Attorney Gregory J Mayew in court for Kahlil Darquise Snow. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Mayew is requesting an adjournment as he just received some new information that he would like to discuss with the State. The State does not object. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Attorney Mayew is requesting an adjournment (email sent to the State and Clerk NN). State may not be able to be in compliance with victims rights. Court denies request to adjourn.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Notice of assignment of judge sent Kahlil Darquise Snow returned. Return to sender. No such number. Unable to forward.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially firearms or edged weapons.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Tashea C

151PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Francesco Balistrieri.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:10 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.  $800  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).   ts
